Reason: The _d configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the size of the tweak value generated in the compTweak function, which in turn affects the final hash output. Changing the value of _d can potentially lead to notable performance variations at the system level, as it affects the execution time and memory consumption of the hashing process. Additionally, since the _d configuration is triggered every time the catena function is called to hash a password, any performance impact from _d will be multiplied by the frequency of its usage, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
